title: Grupa Wielton ze wzrostem przychodów w trzecim kwartale o ponad 23 proc. rok do roku
Nowoczesność na kołach – Wielton na TransLogistica Poland 2025
summary:
11/04/25

Nowoczesność na kołach – Wielton na TransLogistica Poland 2025


Polski producent naczep, przyczep i zabudów ciężarowych – firma Wielton - po raz kolejny prezentuje najnowszą ofertę podczas targów TransLogistica Poland w Warszawie. W trakcie trwającego do 6 listopada br. wydarzenia, na stoisku T15 w hali T można zobaczyć naczepę kurtynową EVO czy wszechstronny pojazd Cargo Master Multi składający się z platformy marki Wielton i zsuwanego nadwozia OpenBox C+ marki Libner Polska.

TransLogistica Poland to największe wydarzenie biznesowe w Europie Środkowo-Wschodniej, skierowane dla firm korzystających z usług logistycznych, transportowych i spedycyjnych, a także do wszystkich związanych z branżą TSL. Podczas tegorocznej, XII edycji tego kluczowego wydarzenia nie mogło zabraknąć firmy Wielton, która tym razem prezentuje wystandaryzowaną naczepę kurtynową oraz wielofunkcyjny pojazd Cargo Master Multi.

- Cieszymy się, że po raz kolejny jesteśmy częścią TransLogistica Poland – jednego z najważniejszych wydarzeń, które łączy całą branżę TSL. To nie tylko okazja do zaprezentowania najnowocześniejszych rozwiązań, ale przede wszystkim przestrzeń do bezpośrednich spotkań i rozmów z klientami, partnerami oraz ekspertami branży. By sektor dalej mógł się rozwijać, kluczowe są otwarty dialog, wymiana doświadczeń i wspólne działania. To od nas wszystkich zależy przyszłość logistyki.
- – mówi Andrzej Mowczan, Dyrektor ds. Komercyjnych, Wielton S.A.

Naczepa kurtynowa Wielton EVO została zaprojektowana z myślą o maksymalnej funkcjonalności i efektywności. Solidna stalowa rama zabezpieczona w procesie malowania kataforetycznego, lekkie aluminiowe komponenty, certyfikat XL oraz certyfikat do przewozu napojów, to tylko część funkcjonalności. Masa własna naczepy EVO to 5600 kg w wersji podstawowej, a jej rama tylko 1750 kg, co oznacza kilkaset kilogramów mniej niż w przypadku tradycyjnych konstrukcji. Drzwi i portal są aluminiowe, a podłoga wykonana ze sklejki wodoodpornej o nośności 7 ton. Ponadto w pojeździe zastosowano wytrzymałe, stalowe słupki portalu przedniego, trwałe osie produkcji BPW oraz składany dach Edscha. Pojazd jest monitorowany za pomocą telematyki Aberg Connect, która stale analizuje stan techniczny i umożliwia łatwą identyfikację miejsca, w którym się znajduje. Uzupełnieniem produktu jest cyfrowa platforma e-commerce, dzięki której cały proces zakupu – od konfiguracji, przez leasing, po podpisanie umowy – może odbyć się w całości online, z dowolnego miejsca i w dowolnym momencie. Online załatwić  można także formalności związane z finansowaniem zakupu. Kluczową częścią cyfrowego ekosystemu EVO jest sklep z częściami, zapewniający stały dostęp do komponentów, bez potrzeby wychodzenia z firmy.

Cargo Master Multi to wielofunkcyjny pojazd wyposażony w innowacyjny system zsuwanego nadwozia Libner Polska, składającego się z dwóch kurtyn bocznych i jednej dachowej. Dzięki temu jedno nadwozie może pełnić aż trzy funkcje: naczepy kurtynowej, podkontenerowej oraz platformy. Taka konstrukcja pozwala na łatwe dostosowanie pojazdu do rodzaju transportowanego ładunku. Nadwozie pojazdu  można w pełni otworzyć, a zastosowane zamki podkontenerowe umożliwiają bezpieczny przewóz kontenerów (2x20’, 1x40’ lub centralnie 1x20’), w tym także kontenerów High Cube – dzięki podwoziu typu MEGA. Mechanizm „Flip-up” pozwala na sprawne składanie i rozkładanie zabudowy, co znacznie ułatwia obsługę. Po złożeniu nadwozia pojazd może być wykorzystywany jako platforma o długości 12,27 m, idealna do transportu rur, materiałów budowlanych czy ładunków ponadgabarytowych. Cargo Master Multi sprawdzi się również w przewozie towarów wymagających dużej szczelności, palet, napojów czy innych ładunków jednostkowych. Zastosowanie jednego pojazdu w miejsce trzech różnych naczep pozwala zoptymalizować flotę, ograniczyć liczbę pustych przejazdów, a tym samym zmniejszyć koszty eksploatacyjne, zużycie paliwa i emisję zanieczyszczeń. To praktyczne i ekologiczne rozwiązanie dla nowoczesnego transportu.

Odwiedzający w dniach 4-6 listopada 2025 r. dwunastą edycję Międzynarodowych Targów Transportu i Logistyki w Warszawie TransLogistica Poland, mogą porozmawiać z ekspertami spółki Wielton na stoisku nr T15 w hali T EXPO XXI, ul. Prądzyńskiego 12/14.

title: Wielton uruchomił autoryzowany punkt sprzedaży pojazdów w siedzibie leasyCAR pod Wrocławiem
summary:
10/15/25

Wielton uruchomił autoryzowany punkt sprzedaży pojazdów w siedzibie leasyCAR pod Wrocławiem


We wrześniu br. firmy Wielton i Leasy CAR S.A. nawiązały współpracę. Na mocy zawartej umowy, w siedzibie leasyCAR w Pietrzykowicach, uruchomiono autoryzowany punkt sprzedaży pojazdów wieluńskiego producenta. Ponadto, naczepy marki Wielton zakupić można także poprzez stronę aukcje.leasycar.pl

W ramach rozbudowy struktur partnerskich Wielton S.A. nawiązał współpracę, na podstawie której Leasy CAR S.A. stał się oficjalnym partnerem firmy. Dzięki temu na Dolnym Śląsku otwarto pierwszy punkt sprzedaży naczep marki mieszczący się w siedzibie leasyCAR w Pietrzykowicach. Na miejscu klienci znajdą szeroki wybór modeli, a także otrzymają kompleksowe wsparcie sprzedażowe i posprzedażowe. Istnieje również możliwość skorzystania z atrakcyjnych form finansowania przy współpracy z wiodącymi firmami leasingowymi, a także z promocyjnych pakietów ubezpieczeniowych. Dodatkowo produkty Wielton są już dostępne do zakupu online za pomocą jednej z największych platform sprzedażowych w Polsce – aukcje.leasycar.pl, a także na portalu OtoMoto.

- Współpraca z leasyCAR to kolejny etap naszej strategii. Łącząc sprzedaż online za pomocą intuicyjnego i łatwego w obsłudze portalu z biurem stacjonarnym oraz ekspozycją produktów marki w okolicach Wrocławia możemy być jeszcze bliżej naszych klientów i skuteczniej odpowiadać na ich potrzeby.
-- mówił Andrzej Mowczan, Dyrektor ds. Sprzedaży Wielton S.A.

– Dzięki partnerstwu z Wielton S.A. możemy naszym klientom umożliwić zakup kolejnych sprawdzonych i różnorodnych rozwiązań znanego, polskiego producenta. To dla nas ważny krok w kierunku rozwoju i urozmaicenia oferty zgodnie z oczekiwaniami rynku.
-– powiedział Grzegorz Dziok, Prezes Zarządu Leasy Car S.A.

Leasy CAR S.A. to marka stworzona przez doświadczonych specjalistów z branży leasingowej, flotowej i benefitowej. Łączy kompetencje operacyjne, technologiczne i finansowe, by dać klientom maksimum przejrzystości i wygody.

title: Grupa Wielton debiutuje na targach EKO-LAS
summary:
09/04/25

Grupa Wielton debiutuje na targach EKO-LAS


Podczas największego spotkania profesjonalistów branży leśnej w Polsce – targach EKO-LAS - jednym z wystawców po raz pierwszy jest Grupa Wielton. W dniach od 4 do 6 września w Mostkach koło Świebodzina zobaczyć można kłonicową naczepę i przyczepę do transportu drewna Woodliner marki Langendorf, jak i naczepę Moving Floor Master marki Wielton wyposażoną w system ruchomej podłogi.

EKO-LAS to uznane wydarzenie branżowe, które cyklicznie przyciąga ponad stu wystawców oraz tysiące zwiedzających, reprezentujących szerokie spektrum sektora leśnego i przemysłu drzewnego w postaci producentów, dostawców i użytkowników sprzętu oraz rozwiązań wykorzystywanych w tym rodzaju gospodarki. Targi wyróżniają się plenerową formułą, gdzie ekspozycja rozlokowana jest na ponad 20 hektarach otwartej przestrzeni, zamiast w tradycyjnych halach wystawienniczych. Podczas tegorocznej edycji wydarzenia, odwiedzający po raz pierwszy mogą zapoznać się z rozwiązaniami marek Langendorf oraz Wielton.

- Tegoroczne targi EKO-LAS to dla nas wyjątkowe wydarzenie z kilku względów. Jako Grupa Wielton po raz pierwszy mamy okazję zaprezentować szerszemu gronu odbiorców swoje produkty, które sprawdzą się w sektorze leśnym. Swoją premierę mają tutaj pojazdy kłonicowe marki Langendorf i uniwersalna naczepa marki Wielton wyposażona w system ruchomej podłogi, która sprawdzi się w transporcie różnorodnych ładunków. Jestem przekonany, że czas spędzony na targach w Mostkach będzie bardzo owocny zarówno dla wystawców, jak i wszystkich odwiedzających wydarzenie. Będzie nam bardzo miło gościć Państwa na naszym stoisku. 
-– mówi Andrzej Mowczan, Dyrektor ds. Sprzedaży, Wielton S.A.

- Cieszymy się, że po raz pierwszy pojazdy kłonicowe z logo Langendorf prezentowane są właśnie na tak istotnym dla branży wydarzeniu jakim są targi EKO-LAS. Produkty Grupy Wielton cechują się wysoką wytrzymałością, a ponadto dostępny jest szereg możliwości wyposażenia dodatkowego. Serdecznie zapraszam do zapoznania się z ofertą oraz rozmów z przedstawicielami Grupy na temat możliwości współpracy.
- – dodaje Tomasz Wypchło, Dyrektor Operacyjny i Członek Zarządu Langendorf Polska Sp. z o.o.

Naczepa kłonicowa Woodliner dzięki wykonaniu z wysokogatunkowej stali S700 oraz zastosowaniu antykorozyjnej powłoki nanoszonej z wykorzystaniem procesu kataforezy posiada wytrzymałą konstrukcję, zapewniającą wysoką nośność i odporność na trudne warunki pracy. Masa własna podwozia wynosi od 4 850 kg, natomiast ładowność administracyjna prezentowanej sztuki to 28 500 kg. Automatyczne napinacze TU podnoszą bezpieczeństwo i gwarantują stabilność transportu, a kształt ściany przedniej pozwala na sprawny rozładunek. W standardowej wersji wyposażenia znajdują się belki ślizgowe, kłonice ExTe z aluminiowymi, teleskopowymi sztycami, ryflowana podłoga czy funkcjonalna drabinka z tyłu pojazdu. Ponadto, producent oferuje szeroki wybór opcji konfiguracji elementów nadwozia, w tym dostępną opcjonalnie trzecią oś skrętną.

Rama przyczepy kłonicowej Woodliner wykonana ze stali S700 wraz z powłoką KTL gwarantuje długą żywotność pojazdu. Wyposażenie w pneumatyczne systemy zawieszenia chronione stalowymi linami minimalizuje wstrząsy, zwiększa stabilność oraz poprawia komfort jazdy na nierównych nawierzchniach. Bezpieczne wejście kierowcy na przyczepę umożliwia zastosowany na jej dyszlu podest wykonany z ryflowanej, ocynkowanej blachy. Dodatkowo, konstrukcja pozwala na elastyczne dopasowanie i zabezpieczenie ładunku, co jest kluczowe podczas transportu długich i ciężkich materiałów, natomiast niskie umiejscowienie środka ciężkości pozytywnie wpływa na stabilność pojazdu podczas transportu. Przyczepa dostępna jest w wariancie 2- i 3-osiowym (PS2SK/PS3SK), w kilku wariantach długości platformy w zakresie od 6 200 mm do 7 200 mm oraz z ogumieniem pojedynczym lub bliźniaczym. W ofercie dostępny jest szeroki wybór wyposażenia (ExTe, Alucar, Autonordic), opcjonalne oświetlenie stroboskopowe czy różne średnice oczka dyszla.

Moving Floor Master marki Wielton to wszechstronny pojazd z ruchomą podłogą umożliwiającą automatyczny, poziomy załadunek i rozładunek ładunków, który dedykowany jest do transportu ładunków drobnicowych, od paczek i towarów spaletyzowanych, po materiały sypkie. Przesuwanie ładunku w wybranym kierunku jest możliwe dzięki zastosowaniu systemu Cargo Floor składającego się z zestawów listew podłogowych, które poruszają się naprzemiennie lub jednocześnie. W produkcie zastosowano ramę szczątkową wykonaną ze stali S700MC od SSAB oraz przesuwną ścianę przednią. Wewnętrzna długość podłogi użytkowej wynosi 13,4 m, natomiast wysokość wewnętrzna to 2,720 m. Naczepa o niskiej masie własnej wynoszącej od 7 200 kg i pojemności 92 m3 może transportować jednocześnie 33 europalety. W zależności od preferencji, klient ma do wyboru układ hamulcowy marek KNORR lub WABCO, osie producentów SAF, BPW lub JOST czy aluminiowe profile podłogi w ilości 21 lub 24 szt. o grubości 6, 8 czy 10 mm. Ponadto, model ten może zostać wyposażony w zarówno prawe, jak i lewe drzwi boczne o szerokości 6 200 mm każde.

Odwiedzający od 4 do 6 września 2025 r. Targi EKO-LAS w Mostkach koło Świebodzina, mogą zapoznać się z portfolio oraz porozmawiać z ekspertami Grupy Wielton przez cały okres trwania wydarzenia.

title: Vicovanu Transport expands fleet with more container carriers
summary:
Vicovanu Transport has expanded its container transport capacity with the delivery of 15 new KRONE Box Liner sliding chassis trailers—bringing the company’s Krone fleet total to 90, with a further 15 on order.

Founded in 2013, Vicovanu is a family-run business that provides a diverse range of road haulage services across the UK. Operating from a strategically located base in Thurrock, Essex, the company also offers a wide array of multimodal logistics solutions, including road, ocean, and air freight.

summary: KRONE will be presenting its new range of tyres at NUFAM 2025 in Karlsruhe.

The aim of the cooperation is to make the distribution of original KRONE spare parts – including components such as underride protection systems – even more customer-oriented and comprehensive in future. The availability of original KRONE spare parts via the winkler distribution network is to be gradually expanded.

title: Uwe Schöneberg completes the Supervisory Board
summary: Uwe Schöneberg (61) has been appointed as a new member of the Supervisory Board of the Krone Group as of 01.05.2025. He is one of the leading industry experts in the German food industry and brings with him extensive know-how from the fields of agriculture and food processing.

title: Krone and Platform Science conclude europe-wide strategic partnership
summary: Everything from a single source: KRONE, one of Europe's leading trailer manufacturers, and Platform Science, formerly Trimble Transport & Logistics, have now entered into a partnership and are launching a fully integrated trailer telematics solution.

title: Truck Efficiency Run
summary: On 10 July 2025, Krone Trailer, together with the Goodyear FIA European Truck Racing Championship (ETRC), is organizing the Truck Efficiency Run powered by Krone - an open competition for truck drivers in which the most efficient driving style, not speed or horsepower, is the deciding factor.

title: Expansion of Krone Tyre Range
summary: At transport logistic 2025 in Munich, Krone will unveil its new trailer tyre: the 445/45R19.5 Krone Trusted Prime:Tyre. This highly economical tyre for volume semitrailers, which will be showcased at stand 201/302 in Hall A6, has been specifically developed for high-volume transport in long-haul and regional operations.

title: Krone presents mykrone.blue
summary: At transport logistic 2025, Krone is unveiling mykrone.blue, a new digital ecosystem that brings together all trailer-related services and data in one central platform for the first time. Designed specifically to meet the needs of fleet operators and transport companies, the solution offers a modern, user-friendly response to the increasing complexity of trailer management.

title: Krone Presents Long HGV for Electric Rigid Trucks
summary: With a Type 3 long HGV optimised for CO₂ efficiency and real-world practicality, Krone is showcasing its extended vehicle portfolio in the field of long truck concepts. The combination on display consists of a rigid truck equipped with Krone's latest-generation Dry Box body, a standard dolly, and a specially configured fifth-generation Profi Liner.

title: Krone Cool Liner in focus: Efficient and versatile
summary: At transport logistic 2025 in Munich, Krone is presenting the Cool Liner with Thermo King Advancer A-500e AxlePower - a fully electric refrigeration system that is powered by a BPW ePower generator axle and an underfloor battery pack.

title: Krone at transport logistic 2025
summary: At transport logistic 2025 in Munich, Krone is presenting itself with the ‘Dimensions in Motion’ concept, as it did at the IAA Transportation 2024, focusing on the four core themes of sustainability, digitalization, automation and electrification - embedded in a modern stand concept that showcases technological advancements in the commercial vehicle sector. Krone will primarily be presenting digital solutions and services at the stand. A long lorry for electric motor vehicles and a Krone Cool Liner will be on display in the outdoor area.

title: Webfleet collaborates with KRONE to offer seamless trailer telematics on one platform
summary: Webfleet, Bridgestone’s globally trusted fleet management solution, is collaborating with KRONE, a leading trailer manufacturer in Europe to offer an integrated telematics solution via its OEM.connect partner programme.

title: Krone Group focuses on stable future plans
summary: Strategic projects dominated the past financial year

title: Future-proof logistics
summary: KRONE at the TEST CAMP INTRALOGISTICS 2025.

title: New committee members at Schwarzmüller Group
summary: Setting the course for stability and customer proximity in Europe.

title: Mapon partners with KRONE on an automatic data exchange integration
summary: Mapon, one of Northern Europe’s leading fleet management solution providers, has partnered with German commercial vehicle manufacturer KRONE to develop an integration solution for more efficient data processing and analysis in the logistics industry.

title: Jürgen Hölscher new member of the Supervisory Board of the KRONE Group
summary: Expanding expertise for stability and sustainable growth.

title: Volker Perk new Managing Director for Production
summary: The KRONE Commercial Vehicle Group is realigning itself against the backdrop of the growing challenges of increasing automation in all production plants. The aim is to future-proof the European production activities for all locations. As part of these plans, Volker Perk will take over the role of Managing Director Production of the KRONE Commercial Vehicle Group, which was previously held by Alfons B. Veer (CTO), on 1 February 2025.

title: Pozkrone: Successful as a KRONE partner in Poland for 30 years
summary: Pozkrone has been responsible for the general distribution of KRONE vehicles in Poland for 30 years. The success story began with the founding of the company in 1994 by Barbara Towpik-Roszkiewicz and Roman Roszkiewicz. Over the past three decades, Pozkrone has managed to sell more than 70,000 KRONE vehicles across the entire KRONE commercial vehicle range - an outstanding success.

title: New Partnership for Seamless Telematics Data Exchange
summary: Two leading providers in the field of telematics, the KRONE Commercial Vehicle Group and TIS GmbH, have entered into an innovative partnership designed to simplify the exchange of telematics data for their customers. The aim of this collaboration is to further drive digitalization in the logistics industry and enable fleet operators to use their data even more efficiently.

title: KRONE Trailer UK expands customer support
summary: KRONE Trailer UK, a leading manufacturer in the commercial trailer industry, is excited to announce that it now has a network of over 400 workshops and repair vans deployed across the UK and Ireland to provide a faster and more efficient trailer support service.

title: Johnson Haulage bolsters fleet with low-loading KRONE quartet
summary: Johnson Haulage has added four new KRONE Profi Liner HD flatbed trailers to its fleet.

title: Andreas Klein is the new Managing Director of Gigant GmbH
summary: Andreas Klein (58) will take up his position as Managing Director of Gigant GmbH in Dinklage on 4 November 2024. The graduate mechanical engineer previously worked for many years in various cross-functional management roles at automotive supplier ZF, including in China and the USA. Klein held a management position at Schmitz Cargobull AG from 2015 to 2018.

title: German Award for Supply Chain Management: Third Place for the Krone Smart Assistant
summary: The Krone Smart Assistant was awarded third place in the 2024 German Award for Supply Chain Management by the Bundesvereinigung Logistik (BVL). “This award confirms our strategy of driving digital innovations and focusing on the needs of our customers,” says Maximilian Birle, Head of Telematics & Digital Services at Krone. “We are proud to have developed a solution with the Smart Assistant that significantly enhances efficiency and transparency in fleet management.”

title: Krone 3D Solar Telematics Wins Telematics Award 2024
summary: Krone 3D Solar Telematics has won the 2024 Telematics Award from the "Telematik Markt.de" media group in the "Trailer Telematics" category.

title: KRONE joins the Alliance Future Tyres (AZuR) network
summary: Trailer manufacturer KRONE, one of the largest in Europe, has joined the Alliance for the Future of Tyres (AZuR) network to work with partners on one of the most pressing challenges of our time: Sustainability in the tyre circular economy.

title: ‘International Trailer Award 2025’ for the KRONE Smart Assistant
summary: KRONE has won the International Trailer Award (ITA) 2025 in the ‘Smart Trailer’ category. The international jury of experts recognized the ‘KRONE Smart Assistant’, which is now available as standard in all new KRONE trailers and offers unique support for drivers and fleet managers.

title: Now Available to Order: The eTrailer from KRONE and Trailer Dynamics
summary: The eTrailer, developed by KRONE in partnership with strategic technology partner Trailer Dynamics, reduces diesel and CO2 emissions of conventional diesel trucks by an average of 40 percent and significantly extends the range of battery-electric semi-trucks.

title: VECTO Calculation Station at IAA Transportation 2024
summary: Starting in 2030, heavy commercial vehicle trailers will need to comply with new limits on CO2 emissions, fuel consumption, and energy usage under EU Regulation 2022/1362, aimed at reducing greenhouse gas emissions and achieving the CO2 targets set by the EU's climate protection package.

title: Smart Assistant: Now with Electronic Consignment Note eCMR
summary: At the IAA Transportation 2024, KRONE is unveiling the KRONE Smart Assistant with the new "eCMR Support" function, now available as standard.

title: KRONE Parts Shop now Features Dedicated Tyre Section and Truck Parts
summary: At the IAA Transportation 2024, KRONE 360° Trailer Service will introduce its expanded tyre range, online tyre shop, and KRONE Truck Parts, all of which can now be conveniently ordered through the online shop at www.KRONE-trailerparts.de.

title: KRONE Cool Liner with ZF "Electrified Trailer System":
summary: KRONE, in partnership with technology provider ZF Friedrichshafen AG, will showcase a KRONE Cool Liner equipped with the ZF "Electrified Trailer System" at the IAA Transportation 2024.

title: KRONE: innovative diversity for the transport industry
summary: KRONE will be exhibiting several vehicles at the IAA Transportation 2024 under the forward-looking motto ‘Dimensions in Motion’.

title: Sustainable and versatile: KRONE eCool Liner
summary: KRONE will be using various exhibits at the IAA Transportation to demonstrate the great versatility of the Cool Liner refrigerated semi-trailer.

title: KRONE Box Liner Automatic: a new dimension of automation for container chassis
summary: IAA Transportation premiere for the KRONE Box Liner Automatic: the automated container chassis has even more advanced automation than the Box Liner, which was presented in 2022.

title: eCELSINEO, the modular cooling system for all-electric operation
summary: Liebherr and KRONE present eCELSINEO as an economical and environmentally friendly solution for trailer refrigeration.

title: Show transporter saves costs and carbon
summary: Event transport specialist Event Ground Support (EGS) has cut costs and its carbon footprint with KRONE's new 11-metre Mega City Dry Liner trailer.

title: The new Box Liner generation
summary: The new generation of KRONE Box Liners, which will be presented for the first time at the IAA Transportation 2024, is based on a multifunctional modular system that enables the transport of all types of sea containers.

title: KRONE at the IAA Transportation 2024
summary: KRONE is launching its pioneering ‘Dimensions in Motion’ concept at the IAA Transportation 2024 in Hanover.

title: 10 years in Sweden - market leader today
summary: Ten years ago, in September 2014, KRONE launched a new sales strategy on the Swedish market: Johan Carlstedt initially set up the import business as an exclusive KRONE partner at the Malmö site with one additional employee.

title: Krone and LKW WALTER celebrate 40 years of partnership with the 40,000th trailer
summary: Krone welcomed a delegation from the Austrian transport organisation LKW WALTER for the ceremonial handover of the 40,000th trailer. The two companies celebrated their 40-year collaboration. In addition to the handover of the anniversary vehicle, the visit to Emsland included tours of the Krone factories and agricultural machinery production facilities.

title: KRONE and Realtrailer establish new company Krone Trailer Service Italia S.R.L.
summary: Fahrzeugwerk Bernard KRONE GmbH & Co. KG and the Italian KRONE importer Realtrailer SRL, Suzzara, Italy, have jointly founded the company KRONE Trailer Service Italia SRL to dynamically develop the spare parts business in Italy.

title: Schwarzmüller becomes a strategic partner in the KRONE Commercial Vehicle Group
summary: The KRONE Group announces its investment in the Schwarzmüller Group and the associated partnership in the European commercial vehicle industry.

title: Rectory Gas Supplies chooses KRONE for Norfolk Expansion
summary: A leading independent LPG supplier has invested in two new KRONE trailers to support the next phase of its expansion.

title: KRONE Trailer supports Blut transportiert e.V.
summary: On 14 June 2024, just in time for the start of the European Football Championship, the logistics initiative Blut transportiert e.V. and DKMS will be holding a major registration campaign at the east entrance to the Olympic Park in Munich with the support of KRONE Trailer.

title: Events transporter grows again as Krone City trailer trumps rigid vehicle for manoeuvrability and cost
summary: A leading events logistics provider has expanded its trailer fleet with the addition of three Dry Liner box trailers from Krone Trailer UK.

title: EMISSION-FREE REFRIGERATED LOGISTICS
summary: The Nagel-Group has put four new electric refrigerated trailers into operation. The trailers with electrically powered refrigeration units enable emission-free and low-noise refrigerated operation for food transport in the fresh and frozen food sector. The e-trailers will be used at the Hamburg, Reichenbach and Traiskirchen (Austria) sites.

title: KRONE Trusted: Spare parts now also for trucks
summary: The KRONE Trusted spare parts brand, which was successfully launched in 2020, is now expanding its range to include spare parts for trucks.

title: KRONE Dry Box - the new generation of swap bodies
summary: Even greater stability, more protection against damage, easier to use - KRONE Dry Box, the new generation of steel smooth-wall swap bodies from KRONE, will be launched in 2024 with ten ingenious enhancements.

title: Partnership with RIO
summary: KRONE and the logistics platform RIO have agreed on an extensive collaboration to drive forward the expansion of their digital services.

title: KRONE and LKW Walter introduce electronic consignment note
summary: The consignment note is what makes the administration of Europe-wide transport possible in the first place and was previously used in paper form and in quadruplicate. This resulted in almost six million paper pages at LKW Walter alone, one of the leading European transport organisations from Austria. These will now be replaced by a fully digital solution.

title: Trailer delivery by rail reduces CO2 emissions
summary: KRONE customers in south-west Germany can now benefit from a new sustainable logistics solution.

title: ECR and KRONE join forces
summary: The founder of ECR Solutions Servicegesellschaft mbH Fred Schäfer and his group of companies have now joined the family business KRONE.

title: New sales subsidiary in Norway
summary: From January 2024, KRONE Norge AS will be responsible for sales of the KRONE Commercial Vehicle Group in Norway.

title: KRONE wins sustainability award 2024
summary: Trailer manufacturer KRONE has won the "European Transport Prize for Sustainability 2024" (ETPN) in the "Telematics and Automation" category.

title: Solutrans 2023 in Lyon
summary: KRONE presents latest innovations

title: Innovation in the fast lane: the eTrailer sets new standards
summary: Misano (IT), Poznan (PL), Nürburgring (DE), Jarama (ES) - at four races of the Goodyear FIA ETRC 2023 racing series, the eTrailer from Krone and Trailer Dynamics was able to thrill the audience on its "Mission Record-Run". The goal was ambitious: The eTrailer, which can save up to 40 percent fuel with its electric drive support, was intended on the one hand to emotionalise the race-enthusiastic drivers on the European race tracks, and on the other hand to create a communicative platform for exchanging ideas about sustainability with technology-savvy decision-makers.

title: 10 years of Krone plant in Tire
summary: This year, Krone is celebrating the tenth anniversary of the Krone plant in Tire (Türkiye), about 60 km south of the provincial capital Izmir.

title: KRONE at the NUFAM 2023
summary: Krone presents itself with a wide range of topics at the NUFAM 2023 in Karlsruhe.

title: KRONE Trailer and TIP Group
summary: KRONE Trailer and TIP Group announce an innovative partnership that ensures immediate, seamless data transfer from KRONE's advanced Telematics hardware to TIP Trailer Telematics applications.

title: 50 years Coil Liner
summary: Just two years after the production of commercial vehicles began at the Werlte site in 1971, Krone already surprised the industry at the IAA 1973 in Frankfurt with a highly specialized vehicle: the first Coil Liner.

title: KRONE introduces new generation of tyres
summary: In summer 2023, Krone will introduce the new "Krone Trusted Tyre Comfort" (KT231) tyre generation. The new trailer tyre with 5 t load capacity features a robust base, a reinforced carcass and a widened tread.

title: Dr. Tono Nasch New Member of the KRONE Group Supervisory Board
summary: To meet the challenges of electrification, automation, sustainability and digitisation strategically and even more intensively, entrepreneur Dr. Tono Nasch has been called as an additional member of the KRONE Group Supervisory Board effective 01/06/2023.

title: KRONE: new importer in Bulgaria
summary: On 1 August 2023, CTE Trailers will start as the new official importer for Krone in Bulgaria, succeeding the previous importer Krone BG Ltd.

title: 100 years of KRONE customers
summary: 100 years of Spedition Sommer - To celebrate, KRONE handed over a Profi Liner in a special design.

title: Krone Smart Assistant
summary: The current trailer status - without investment

title: KRONE eTrailer - Sustainability and emotionality are not mutually exclusive
summary: The Krone eTrailer will start the "Record-Run" at various races of the Goodyear FIA European Truck Racing Championship 2023 racing series.

title: KRONE at the transport logistic 2023
summary: "Mission Beyond Zero" - sustainability with a system

title: 25 years of KRONE Profi Liner
summary: Krone's bestseller: Technology carrier in the 5th generation

title: Krone Trusted: the spare parts brand in Krone quality
summary: The Krone Trusted spare parts brand, which was launched two years ago, was able to gain further market share in 2022. More than 300 different tested brand-name spare parts, which cover more than 80 percent of the common wear parts on trailers and are up to 50 percent lower in price than the original spare parts, can be ordered from Krone throughout Europe from January 2021.

title: Krone joins goodyear FIA ETRC as official Partner
summary: The European Truck Racing Association (ETRA) announced today the start of a new partnership with German commercial vehicle manufacturer Krone.

title: Study of Capacity shortages in Logistics
summary: A study team led by Prof. Dr. Wolfgang Stölzle of Logistics Advisory Experts, Prof. Dr.-Ing. Thorsten Schmidt of the Technical University of Dresden and Prof. Dr. Christian Kille of the Institute for Applied Logistics at the University of Applied Sciences Würzburg-Schweinfurt has investigated how personnel shortages affect the logistics industry and how they can be solved.

title: Presentation of the Vario Liner of the second generation
summary: More stability, better handling, shorter turnaround times and thus more efficiency in part-load transports are promised by the new double-deck trailer presented yesterday by the Europäische Ladungs-Verbund Internationaler Spediteure (ELVIS) AG.

title: Markus Stegen new to the management board
summary: Markus Stegen (46) has joined the management board with effect from 4 October 2022 and will initially be responsible for Product Management and New Markets in the KRONE Commercial Vehicle Group. Other areas of responsibility will follow successively.

title: Krone Group increases turnover to 2.5 billion euros
summary: Despite a market environment that remains tense, the Krone Group generated sales of around 2.5 billion euros in the 2021/2022 financial year (01.08.2021 - 31.07.2022), more than 15 percent above the previous year's level (around 2.2 billion euros).

title: Krone: Review of the year 2022
summary: For Krone, the year 2022 was marked by groundbreaking innovations.

title: Dr Bernard Krone Foundation donates EURO 250,000
summary: The appeal for donations in commemoration of family entrepreneur Dr.-Ing. E.h. Bernard Krone raised a record sum of nearly €250,000.

title: Fürmetz Logistik relies on Krone
summary: Fürmetz Logistik GmbH, Taufkirchen an der Vils, has now taken delivery of 15 new Krone construction material trailers.

title: Krone Telematics Portal
summary: Just in time for the IAA Transportation, Krone Telematics introduced new standards and services, making it even easier for customers to access their telematics data easily from anywhere.

title: Krone Ice Protect Air
summary: Frosty temperatures quickly lead to snow and ice on the tarpaulin roof - every driver knows this problem. This is because the removal of all ice and snow residues from the vehicle roof and the trailer tarpaulin, as required by law, is a dangerous matter on the road and often difficult to carry out in practice.

title: Transport of building materials
summary: With the two-axle trailer "Load Carrier Baustofftransport" and the semi-trailer "Profi Liner Baustofftransport", Krone offers vehicle concepts that are specially tailored to the requirements of the construction industry and can be flexibly configured.

title: Krone 360° Trailer Service
summary: The services of Krone 360° Trailer Service are increasingly shaped by digitalization.

title: The Krone Dry Liner STG
summary: From the wide-ranging programme that Krone presented at the IAA Transportation, the Dry Liner STG with all available safety options also attracted great interest. The exhibit, which is also suitable for operation in a long-truck combination (type 3), is equipped with an air-suspended axle unit with self-steering axle to allow safe and agile manoeuvring at all times, even in confined conditions.

title: Krone wins Telematics Award 2022
summary: Trailer manufacturer Krone has won the "Telematik Award 2022" in the trailer telematics category. This coveted industry award is presented by the media group Telematik-Markt.de, which uses it to honor outstanding development achievements and solutions in the field of telematics. In the competition, Krone impressed with its "telematics of the third dimension" concept, which is particularly characterized by the use of new sensors and the application of artificial intelligence ("AI").

title: Green innovation in surface transport
summary: DB Schenker is continuing to drive the green transformation in land transport and is consistently focusing on sustainable innovations. This week, the logistics service provider signed a cooperation agreement with Trailer Dynamics and the Krone Commercial Vehicle Group on the use of eTrailers in European land transport.

title: Dr. Bernard Krone has passed away
summary: It is with deep sadness that we inform you of the passing of long-time owner of the Krone Group, Dr.-Ing. E.h. Bernard Krone, after a short serious illness in Spelle, Emsland, on October 14th, 2022 at the age of 82.

title: KLVrent has relied on Krone trailers for over 25 years
summary: KLVrent, the largest brand- and group-independent rental company for heavy commercial vehicles in the German-speaking region, has now added another 90 Krone trailers to its fleet. In total, the medium-sized company, which was founded in 1972, currently has around 1,600 vehicles that are no more than three to four years old, around half of which are towed units but also special vehicles for transport and waste disposal.

title: Krone at the IAA 2022
summary: At the IAA Transportation 2022 in Hanover (20.09.-25.09.2022), Krone recorded strong visitor numbers on all days of the show. At a total of eleven exhibits in and in front of Hall 27, interested visitors were able to experience first-hand both innovative technology carriers and fully equipped Krone trailers for tough everyday transport operations.

title: Astrid Janke new on the management board
summary: Astrid Janke (51) has taken over as Managing Director in the design and development division of the Krone Commercial Vehicle Group with effect from April 1, 2022. In recent months, she has been successively familiarized with all tasks by her predecessor Uwe Sasse; in the meantime, Uwe Sasse has started partial retirement as planned.

title: KRONE COMBINES ALL DIGITAL SOLUTIONS UNDER ONE ROOF
summary: At IAA Transportation 2022 in Hanover, Krone will present its new digital strategy “Krone Intelligent Transport Solutions” (KITS).

title: DB Schenker: conversion of trailer fleet to mega trailers
summary: During the IAA exhibition in Hanover, DB Schenker, one of the world’s leading logistics service providers and the leader in European land transport, and Krone completed the handover of the first of 200 Krone Mega Liners for DB Schenker’s French network. DB Schenker’s goal is to increasingly shift from trailer transports to megatrailer transports so that more goods can be transported with one truck.

title: "MISSION BEYOND ZERO": KRONE REDUCES CO2 EMISSIONS
summary: At the IAA Transportation 2022 in Hanover, Krone’s exhibit follows the slogan: “Mission Beyond Zero”. In general, during transport, trailers do not actively consume any fossil fuels nor emit any CO2. But Krone is now going one step further with its “Mission Beyond Zero”, helping active fuel consumers improve their carbon footprint by using Krone eTrailer technology to take the strain off the tractor unit and thus reduce the semi-trailer's CO2 emissions.

title: KRONE eMEGA LINER: CURTAINSIDER WITH ELECTRIC TRACTOR UNIT ASSISTANCE
summary: At the IAA Transportation 2022 in Hanover, Krone is exhibiting three flatbed semitrailers: the eMega Liner, which uses battery electric power to assist the tractor in its drive, the Profi Liner, which demonstrates the versatility of Krone’s Multi Safe load securing system, and the Profi Liner Comfort, which makes the driver’s job much easier with its ergonomic features.

title: KRONE 360° TRAILER SERVICE
summary: At the IAA Transportation 2022 in Hanover, Krone will demonstrate the comprehensive services offered by the Krone 360° Trailer Service, which are increasingly influenced by digitalization.

title: SUSTAINABLE AND VERSATILE: KRONE COOL LINER
summary: Through three exhibits at IAA Transportation, Krone will be demonstrating the great versatility of the Cool Liner refrigerated semitrailer.

title: KRONE SMART CAPACITY MANAGEMENT – A GLIMPSE INSIDE THE TRAILER
summary: Krone will unveil its Smart Capacity Management intelligent load space detection system, which is now ready for series production, at the IAA Transportation 2022 in Hanover.

title: KRONE:SWAP SYSTEMS- WIDE VARIETY
summary: The Carrier System makes Krone one of the leading providers of robust and efficient swap systems – from the Box Carrier Chassis and Profi Box swap flatbeds right through to the refrigerated and unrefrigerated Cool Box and Dry Box.

title: KRONE: WORLD PREMIERE OF THE BOX LINER AUTOMATIC
summary: Krone will be showcasing what their next-generation trailers will look like at the IAA Transportation 2022 in Hanover under the key areas of "sustainability, digitalisation, automation and electrification".

title: KRONE TELEMATICS PORTAL: THE ALL-IN-ONE SOLUTION FOR LOGISTIC
summary: In order to bundle data from a wide variety of telematics systems on a single interface, Krone utilises a flexible data structure and an optimised, clear display.

title: TELEMATICS UNIT WITH SOLAR POWER: AUTONOMOUS AND MAINTENANCE-FREE
summary: The Krone Smart Collect Solar (KSC Solar) telematics and diagnostics unit is the practical response to the demand for a mobile, autonomous and completely maintenance-free option for the precise positioning of vehicles and mobile units.

title: KRONE TELEMATICS PORTAL: OPEN INTERFACES AND SELF-SERVICE
summary: Krone Telematics will be setting new standards and services at the IAA Transportation 2022, underscoring its strategy of making telematics data available wherever the customer needs it.

title: ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE DETECTS AVAILABLE LOADING SPACE
summary: Krone will unveil its Smart Capacity Management intelligent load space detection system, which is now ready for series production, at the IAA Transportation 2022 in Hanover.

title: KRONE: DENKFABRIK LIVE AT THE IAA TRANSPORTATION
summary: In addition to numerous innovations, visitors to the IAA Transportation 2022 in Hanover can expect a varied and multi-faceted programme with the “Krone Denkfabrik”.

title: KRONE: DRY LINER STG ALSO FOR LONG HGV OPERATION
summary: At IAA Transportation 2022 in Hanover, Krone will be exhibiting a Dry Liner STG, with all available safety options, from its wide range. The Dry Liner STG is also suitable for operation in a long-HGV combination (type 3).

title: Strategic partnership for automated logistics
summary: In order to significantly advance the automation of logistics and transport solutions, especially in the area of trailers, the commercial vehicle specialist Krone, which is active throughout Europe, and Fernride, the innovation leader for autonomous & teleoperated transport solutions, have signed a strategic partnership. Within the framework of this cooperation, an automated trailer is to be developed that initially implements the automation of important secondary functions, such as the coupling process, the opening/closing of doors or the sensory environment analysis.

title: Krone wins Trailer Innovation Award 2023
summary: Krone has been awarded the Trailer Innovation Award in the "Chassis" category for the Box Liner eLTU 50 Traction Automatic. The international jury of 15 European trade magazines thus honoured the technology carrier, which will be presented for the first time at the IAA Transportation.

title: Krone: “Mission Beyond Zero”
summary: At the IAA Transportation 2022 in Hanover (20/0922–25/09/2022), Krone will be presenting a total of eleven exhibits. Innovative prototypes connected to the megatrends of “digitalization, automation, sustainability and electrification” can be seen at the Krone trade fair stand C40 in Hall 27 as well as right next door at the Krone stands in the outdoor area (N41, Q41, P43).

title: Service network continuously expanded
summary: The trailer manufacturer Krone and the cross-brand full-service workshop concept of Alltrucks Truck & Trailer Service can look back on a very satisfactory development in the expansion of the joint service network after a good year since the start of the cooperation.

title: With artificial intelligence against trailer breakdowns
summary: Under the project title "value chAIn", Krone is currently using artificial intelligence (AI) to analyse optimisation possibilities with regard to product and process quality, performance and availability. In view of the research goal of error management across the value chain, the Krone project team has defined four concrete use cases.

title: Krone plant in Tire, Turkey under new management
summary: The long-standing CEO of the Krone plant in Turkey, Riza Akgün, will retire from the Krone Commercial Vehicles Group on 31 July 2022 and gradually hand over the management of the Krone production site in Tire, Turkey, to Kartal Erköy, Managing Director Production, and Semih Pala, Managing Director Finance/Sales, from May 2022.

title: KRONE TPMS – THE SMART TYRE PRESSURE MONITORING SYSTEM
summary: From 6 July 2024, active tyre pressure monitoring systems will be required by law, for all commercial trailers over 3.5 tonnes.

title: Krone and Shippeo – real-time shipping updates
summary: At IAA Transportation 2022 in Hanover, Krone will present its integrated tracking services, which have been seamlessly integrated with Krone Telematics.

title: VR-Award 2022 in the category “Education and Training"
summary: Krone achieved first place in the "Education and Training in the Manufacturer Sector" category of the 2022 VR Awards. The trade magazine "VerkehrsRundschau" thus honors Krone's digital working student project, which was launched in August 2021.

title: Rolling event stage for the BGL from Krone
summary: At the end of April, the German Road Haulage, Logistics and Waste Disposal Association (in German: BGL) was provided with a flexible swap system from Krone. The combination consists of the container chassis Box Liner eLTU 50 and a Krone swap body, which is converted into a shop box. The custom-built system will soon be complemented by an interchangeable flatbed that has been converted so that it can be used as a stage for events.

title: Spedition Ludwig Pall relies on trailers from Krone
summary: Ludwig Pall Speditions – und Transport GmbH from Oberwart, Austria, has added two new Krone Profi Liners to its fleet. The first-class equipped trailers have, among others, the comfortable load securing tarpaulin Safe Curtain as well as a lifting roof, alloy wheels and pallet box.

title: Krone as partner for study of capacity constraints
summary: The consortium study “Meeting capacity bottlenecks in logistics: situation – solutions – potentials – packages of measures – roadmaps”, launched on February 17, 2022, aims to research the driver shortage and its impact on transport companies and their customers.

title: New addition to Krone Executive Board
summary: A strong growth in all business segments has led the Krone group to expand its executive board as of 1 April 2022. The decision was taken by the supervisory board and its chair Bernard Krone who says it will strengthen the viable group structures as the family business continues on its course for success.

title: KARL JÜRGENSEN has been using Krone for 40 years
summary: The Karl Jürgensen company recently took delivery of two long HGVs from Krone. The type 3 combinations - three-axle motor vehicle, actively steered Krone dolly and Dry Liner semi-trailer - are 25.25 m long. As special equipment, the box bodies have double deck systems and floors reinforced to 8 t load capacity by additional cross beams.

title: ECR and Krone with strategic partnership
summary: The Krone Commercial Vehicle Group and the service provider ECR Solutions have agreed on a strategic partnership: The aim of the cooperation is the joint further development of service packages in the area of fleet management. The background to the cooperation is the constantly growing challenges facing the logistics industry and its market participants.

title: CELSINEO order intake 2022 above expectations
summary: The modular trailer refrigeration units of the CELSINEO brand, a cooperation between the companies Krone and Liebherr, have already been successfully used by numerous renowned customers since their market launch in 2021 - and demand is continuously increasing. One of the major success factors is the reliable service network.

title: One year Krone Trusted: Spare parts brand on the upswing
summary: Krone Trusted has been very well received by the market: The new spare parts brand started with a stock of around one million euros, which was already turned over in the first year. Krone Trusted sees itself as an inexpensive alternative to original spare parts without compromising on quality.

title: Krone receives European research contract
summary: As part of the GAIA-X research project, the German Federal Ministry of Economics (BMWi) has given the commercial vehicle manufacturer Krone the task of developing a concept that optimises the flow of goods and commodities through the intelligent use of data.

title: DONAULAGER LOGISTICS adds Cool Liner with CELSINEO
summary: DONAULAGER LOGISTICS adds more modern vehicles to its fleet: All new Krone Cool Liners are equipped with the modular CELSINEO cooling unit, a joint development by Liebherr and Krone. The great flexibility and high availability of the refrigeration convinced the international logistics service provider.

title: eTrailer wins ZENIT Innovation Award
summary: The Aachen-based company Trailer Dynamics, founded in 2018, and Krone want to make a significant contribution to "green logistics". The basis is the eTrailer, a powerful electric axle that works independently of the tractor unit. The tests with a first prototype confirm the high expectations of the innovative system. On 17 January 2022, Trailer Dynamics and Krone were awarded the Innovation Prize of the ZENIT e.V. Network.

title: Krone sales revenues grow to €2.2 billion
summary: In consistently challenging markets, the Krone Group generated sales of about 2.2 billion euros in the financial year 2020/2021 (01/08/2020 – 31/07/2021), surpassing the results of the previous year (1.9 billion euros). 75 percent of this revenue was earned in markets outside Germany and 25 percent in Germany.

title: Electrically powered trucks in food distribution
summary: In the greater Budapest area, the WIN Capital Group has recently put five electrically powered articulated trucks into operation, which are intended for deliveries to Aldi branches. As part of this cooperation, five exclusively designed Cool Liners from Krone are combined with fully electric semitrailer tractors. The drives were specially converted for this project to be able to deliver goods with low emissions within a radius of 230 km.

title: LTN remains loyal to BVB and Krone
summary:
The transport company LTN has now picked up two Coil Liners and four Mega Liners in Werlte. Two Mega Liners with BVB-09 look were particularly eye-catching. Managing Partner Marco Niedenführ explained: "LTN's main location is Dortmund and we in the family and a large part of our employees are really crazy about football. As passionate BVB fans, we also want to communicate this clearly to the outside world with our fleet." 
In addition to the four Mega Liners, LTN now also uses two new Coil Liners for steel transport, which is one of LTN's main areas of focus alongside beverage and food logistics. "All 25 trailers that we currently use in our fleet come from Krone. Over the past 16 years, LTN has grown rapidly from a one-man operation to a company with 160 employees and ten locations. But our philosophy remains unchanged: we want to offer all our customers the best possible full service. The quality we find at Krone fits this perfectly. This applies not only to the vehicles, but also to the complete package that Krone offers, such as Krone Telematics or the FairCare service offers. Such solutions provide enormous support in cost management, for example," Marco Niedenführ emphasised.

title: The year 2021: Anniversaries, innovations and challenges
summary: 50 years of trailer production in Werlte, 25 years of Cool Liner, 1 millionth chassis number: In 2021, Krone celebrated three special anniversaries. In addition, the past year stands for a series of innovations that Krone was able to successfully introduce to the market, but also in connection with unprecedented market challenges.

title: The type 1 long HGV in the fast lane
summary: Krone is paving the way with its new Swap Liner, demonstrating how a type 1 long HGV (extended semitrailer) can easily transport two swap bridges each 7.45 metres long. Last year, amended traffic regulations for this combination raised the maximum permissible overall length from 17.80 m to 17.88 m. Prompted by this change, Krone developed the new Swap Liner – specifically for transporting two 7.45 m long swap bridges. Compared to the lorry plus trailer, this trailer combination saves about 1.5 litres of fuel per 100 km.

title: First Celsineo units in the Netherlands for Amex and Baas
summary: Krone is playing an increasingly important role in the transport of conditioned goods, where there is a wide variety. The company has now delivered the first refrigerated trailers in the Netherlands equipped with the new, modular Celsineo refrigeration machine. The trailers were delivered to Amex in Lelystad and Baas Warehousing and Transport in Bunschoten.

title: 40 Krone trailers for STERAC
summary: At the official handover of 40 new Krone curtainsider semi-trailers for the transport company STERAC, Managing Director Gerald Rackebrandt and Frank Knuhr (Head of Purchasing/Fleet) visited Krone in Werlte. During a detailed tour of the factory, the guests from Braak in Schleswig-Holstein were convinced by the ultra-modern trailer production in the new Krone surface coating centre.

title: 1,000,000th Krone chassis goes to TIP
summary: The vehicle with the millionth chassis number WKESD000001000000 has now rolled off the Krone production line: a Cool Liner from the Lübtheen plant for the Norwegian branch of the TIP Trailer Services. In 1971 TIP was one of the first customers when Krone started their trailer construction business.

title: Commitment to the Logistics Alliance Germany
summary: The Logistics Alliance Germany has elected Dr Frank Albers, Managing Director Marketing and Sales at Krone, as the new Deputy Chairman of the Board. The elections took place at the 14th general meeting in November 2021. Also new to the board is Dr Jens Gräter, Head of International Affairs at Deutsche Bahn.

title: On an innovative mission
summary: Driving innovations with practice-oriented equipment - this is how the latest activity of the Swiss transport company Salzmann can be described. The latest addition to the fleet of Salzmann AG Transporte is a three-axle container chassis from the Krone Box Liner eL20 series for the transport of 20' containers. The new Box Liner is currently used for transports of the Bern-based start-up company Neustark.

title: For professional flower transport
summary: The Spanish transport company ESP Solutions has once again opted for Krone and ordered 250 refrigerated trailers from the Cool Liner series. This means that ESP Solutions now has a fleet of around 700 trailers, including 600 Krone Cool Liner. The average age of the fleet is two years.

title: Krone at Solutrans 2021
summary: In keeping with the motto of Solutrans 2021, "International show for road and urban transport solutions", Krone will be showing two vehicles and its comprehensive "Krone 360° Trailer Service" programme at its stand 4 C085 in hall EXT.

title: Cool Liner with Celsineo aggregate for KTN Grossmann
summary: Tobias Grossmann, Managing Director of KTN Grossmann, has now taken delivery of his first Krone Cool Liner with double-deck equipment and a CELSINEO refrigeration unit. Celsineo's future-proof technology works with three independently operating refrigeration modules, ensuring high availability in operation and simplified service.

title: RYTLE and Krone supporting new delivery concepts
summary: From the beginning of November 2020, four swap bodies that can hydraulically lowered to the ground – so called HUBs – will support the transport of goods between the Rhenus Home Delivery warehouse in Hoppegarten and the micro depot in Westhafen Berlin. Thereof, this will enable easier delivery to end customers in the city centre. The HUBs are provided by the project partner RYTLE, who has already established itself on the market with its smart logistics concept for the last mile. The swap body, produced in Herzlake by the commercial vehicle specialist Krone Commercial Vehicle SE, is characterised as a mobile depot with little space requirement. Due to the hydraulic lifting system as well as the electric gates, an uncomplicated loading and unloading can be enabled.

title: 4 new Cool Liners for Miniekspress
summary: Four new Cool Liners from Krone are now in use at the Norwegian transport company Miniekspress Thermo Transport AS. The cooling trailers were specified according to Miniekspress' requirements and offer e.g. an interior height of 2800 mm and double-deck loading with a floor space for 54 pallets. A multiple variable cooling zone division is made possible by an insulated partition wall in the longitudinal direction. This Multitemp solution offers three individually adjustable chambers for the transport of fresh and frozen goods. An additional evaporator, which is accommodated in a space-saving manner on the rear portal, ensures excellent temperature regulation in the individual chambers. A further feature of the new Miniekspress Cool Liner is the equipment with battery operated tail lifts.

title: STERAC relies on Krone trailers
summary: In October, Managing Director Gerald Rackebrandt and Purchasing/Fleet Manager Frank Knuhr came to the Krone vehicle plant in Werlte to officially take delivery of 40 new Krone curtainsider semi-trailers for STERAC Transport & Logistik GmbH.

title: Focus on customer benefit
summary: Transport companies using telematics systems from the two leading trailer manufacturers Schmitz Cargobull and Krone can now access the data provided for all their vehicles via their individual access points - regardless of the telematics hardware installed or the telematics portal used. This straightforward and extremely convenient solution is made possible thanks to a cooperation between Cargobull Telematics and Krone Telematics: both manufacturers have opened their standardized interfaces for the respective other system.

title: Perfect for the 75th birthday
summary: During the official handover of 20 new semi-trailers of the Profi Liner series, Dr. Frank Albers, Krone Managing Director Sales & Marketing and Krone Regional Sales Manager Norbert Brink congratulated the forwarding agency Heinemann on its 75th anniversary. Managing Director Susanne-Petra Heinemann and Fleet Manager Siegfried Kesting received the vehicles with the eye-catching inscription 'The Krone team congratulates on 75th anniversary' at the local depot in Korbach.

title: Nagel-Group and Herta test THT New Cool
summary: Bochum, 9 December 2020. The food logistics company Nagel-Group and the ham and sausage maker Herta are working towards more sustainable logistics. The companies are jointly testing the practical application of a fully electric semi-trailer truck. “Climate change poses a serious threat, and we have to make every effort to significantly reduce CO2 emissions. Logistics plays a significant role in this regard. That is why we gladly agreed to take part in this trial project,” says Bettina Fürstenberg, Managing Director at Herta.

title: 20 neue Mega Liner für Toni Hotz Transporte GmbH
summary: Den ersten von 20 neuen Mega Linern holte jetzt Alexander Hotz, Inhaber und Geschäftsführer der Spedition Toni Hotz Transporte GmbH, in Werlte ab. Die neuen Fahrzeuge werden sukzessiv die älteren Mega Liner im Hotz Fuhrpark ersetzen. Bei den neuen Volumenaufliegern, die jeweils über 15 m Fahrzeuglänge verfügen, setzt Hotz auf moderne Ausstattung wie z.B. auf die innovative Ladungssicherungsplane Safe Curtain, bei der hochfeste Federstahlstreifen in vertikalen PVC-Tunneltaschen in die Seitenplanen integriert sind. Der Vorteil: Da auf klassische Einstecklatten verzichtet werden kann, ist nicht nur das Handling des Safe Curtain einfacher, sicherer und schneller, sondern im Vergleich zur herkömmlichen Seitenplane mit Einstecklatten ergibt sich auch noch eine Gewichtseinsparung von rd. 100 kg. Selbstverständlich erfüllt der Safe Curtain die Vorgaben der Daimler Ladungssicherung 9.5 und ist für den Getränketransport sowie nach EN 12642 Code XL zertifiziert.

title: Trailer Dynamics and Krone announce strategic partnership
summary: Trailer Dynamics GmbH and trailer manufacturer Krone have announced a strategic partnership. The common goal is to develop an electrified trailer ready for series production that significantly reduces the diesel and CO2 emissions of diesel semi-trailers and increases the range of BEV semi-trailers. The prototype of the eMega Liner was presented for the first time during the Krone Executive Logistics Summit at the Krone Future Lab in Lingen at the end of September. During the first test runs, which were accompanied by SGS TÜV Saar GmbH, the eMega Liner was already able to achieve the targeted diesel and CO2 emission reductions of up to 20 percent.

title: Executive Logistics Summit at the Krone Future Lab
summary: On 23 and 24 September 2021, the "Executive Logistics Summit" took place at the Krone Future Lab in Lingen, a new exclusive event format by KRONE in cooperation with the ETM publisher for top decision-makers from the transport and logistics industry. The two-day programme offered the opportunity for an exchange of experts on the mega-topics of digitalization, sustainability and automation in three practice-oriented workshops. More than 120 guests followed the top-class workshops. Two particular highlights were the keynote speech by Hildegard Müller, President of the German Association of the Automotive Industry, and the keynote speech by Dr Philipp Rösler, member of the supervisory board of Brainloop AG and former Vice Chancellor.

title: Krone Box Liner eLTU 40 Light Traction
summary: Due to the current economic upswing, worldwide container transports are experiencing an unprecedented boom phase. Innovative and universal container chassis are a must have. "In the demanding business of container trucking, every minute counts. Ideally, the chassis must be suitable for all containers, even the heavy ones from 20' to 45'. With our Box Liner eLTU 40 Light Traction, our customers are ideally positioned in this demanding market", says Krone product manager Ulrich Josefowitsch. The new Box Liner, which was launched at the beginning of 2021, impresses with a tare weight of only 4.2 t - putting it in the top group of lightweights in this class. This was achieved by using high-strength S700 fine-grain steel and a frame optimised with the help of the finite element method (FEM). Krone did not compromise on robustness, which has been verified over many months in tough test cycles.

title: Krone at Nufam 2021
summary: "NUFAM 2021 is the first major industry meeting point this year. We are very much looking forward to meeting our customers in person - it's finally getting restarted," says Dr Frank Albers, Krone Managing Director Sales and Marketing, in the run-up to the commercial vehicle trade fair in Karlsruhe. From 30 September to 3 October, Krone will be on site with its show trailer at Stand D 103 in Hall 1.

title: Krone at Comtrans 2021 in Moscow
summary: Krone, together with its general importer RKS Nutzfahrzeuge LTD, will present the latest transport solutions for the demanding Russian market at Comtrans 2021 in Moscow from 7 to 11 September. The focus of the Krone stand 13-222 in hall 13 is the new Cool Liner generation, which is equipped with Krone Telematics as standard. On the occasion of its 25th anniversary, the premium refrigerated trailer will be presented with numerous detail improvements as well as a comprehensive range of additional equipment. The Carrier Vector 1550 S diesel-electric refrigeration unit with integrated printer ensures reliable temperature control.

title: Simon Richenhagen appointed Head of Marketing
summary: Simon Richenhagen (31) has been appointed Head of Marketing of the Krone Commercial Vehicle Group with effect from 1st August 2021. Richenhagen, who has worked in the Marketing department at Krone since 2016, most recently as Brand Manager, focused predominantly on the development of digital marketing concepts and on the brand positioning of Krone.

title: Krone supports KRAVAG Truck Parking
summary: To help alleviate the shortage of parking spaces for truck drivers, KRAVAG Insurance has launched KRAVAG Truck Parking for its customers - a kind of parking space sharing for trucks. Here, haulage companies and businesses offer free parking spaces on their premises, which can then be conveniently booked by drivers and dispatchers via app. To support this programme, Krone is now providing four parking spaces: two at the new vehicle delivery facility at the Werlte plant and two at the Krone site in Spelle.

title: Industry initiative #Logistikhilft
summary: Krone is once again supporting DocStop and will cover the rental costs of a sanitary container with toilet and shower on the premises of Paul Schockemöhle Logistics for one year. The sanitary container is located directly on the A1 motorway, Holdorf exit. The container is supplied and maintained by Schockemöhle. The use of the container is free of charge for truck drivers, who are particularly dependent on uninterrupted access to sanitary facilities with showers and toilets during the Corona pandemic.

title: Krone Trusted: Trust pays off
summary: The launch of the Krone Trusted brand at the beginning of 2021 has exceeded all expectations and has been very well received by transport companies and workshops. „We are experiencing a very positive and great response both nationally and internationally", says Ralf Faust, Managing Director Service of the Krone Commercial Vehicle Group. A large number of Krone customers have placed their first orders in the six months since the market launch and have since become regular customers in the Krone Spare Parts Online Shop. (www.krone-trailerparts.com).

title: Krone Telematics: the all-in-one solution
summary: In order to be able to easily manage different telematics systems via a single portal solution, Krone Telematics relies on a manufacturer-independent platform. Here, the various stand-alone solutions are combined into an all-in-one solution. Regardless of the vehicle type, manufacturer or telematics box used, the user has individual, user-specific access and can access all the data provided. With the Krone Telematics Portal, fleet operators always have an overview of their vehicles, and with the Krone Telematics App, the data is also always available on the move.

title: The 3,333rd Krone Trailer for Hegelmann
summary: The internationally active Hegelmann Group has now taken delivery of its 3,333rd trailer from Krone. Chairman of the Supervisory Board Bernard Krone, Managing Director Dr Frank Albers and the responsible Regional Sales Manager Klaus Foser welcomed the shareholders of the Hegelmann Group Siegfried and Anton Hegelmann in Spelle, who, accompanied by CFO Tomas Jurgelevicius, took delivery of the milestone vehicle. For this special event, the Cool Liner of the latest generation was provided with special lettering, which underlines the long-standing good partnership.

title: German „Road Safety Day“ 19 June 2021
summary: An essential aspect for a high level of safety in road traffic is seeing and being seen. Good visibility is also enormously important for truck combinations with trailers and semi-trailers. Cyclists and pedestrians in particular can find themselves in the blind spot from the truck driver's perspective in certain traffic situations. This is especially true as soon as the truck turns into a bend and cyclists or pedestrians can no longer be seen in the truck mirror at a certain angle.

title: The new generation of Krone Dry Liners
summary: Krone has further strengthened the Dry Liner product portfolio in terms of quality and configuration variety through an extensive investment in industrial production lines. By combining this with the flexible Krone modular system, a wide variety of industry solutions can be created. Based on the four basic models of the Krone Dry Liner, almost any customer requirement can be fulfilled.

title: „Green Truck Innovation Award 2021“
summary: The German trade magazines "Verkehrs-Rundschau" and "Trucker" have awarded Krone and its Dutch partner THT the "Green Truck Innovation 2021" award for the Cool Liner "THT New Cool". Krone Managing Director Sales and Marketing, Dr Frank Albers and THT owner Twan Heetkamp received the prestigious award on 9 June at the "VR Gala 2021" in Neuss, Germany. With the annual "Green Truck" environmental label awarded in various categories, the magazines from the Heinrich Vogel publishing house provide important guidance for the purchase and operation of environmentally friendly vehicles.

title: Krone Dry Liner
summary: Krone has doubled capacities with the new Dry Liner production at the Herzlake site. Thanks to the use of two new lines, the wide range with numerous equipment variants and options can be manufactured to the highest quality.

title: Fresh fish logistics in Norway
summary: Norwegian food logistics company Nor-log Thermo AS is putting 55 new Cool Liners into operation. The first batch of Krone refrigerated trailers, specially designed to meet Norwegian requirements, has now been handed over to Ståle Gjerde (Nor-log Group) and Kjell Didriksen (Nor-Log Thermo) by Preben Ferre (Vogn-Service).

title: The new Mega Liner Generation
summary: Evolution instead of revolution: Krone has gradually revamped its Mega Liner program over the past few years. The result is an innovative volume vehicle that offers transport companies numerous tangible advantages.

title: SAP update leads to disruptions
summary: Due to an SAP update, there will be disruptions and outages from Thursday, 13 May to Sunday, 16 May 2021. This means that the SAP-based KRONE customer portals will not be accessible during this period. The following areas are affected by the maintenance work and the resulting impairments:

title: Visitors test Scania trucks with Krone trailers
summary: Scania's test and demo centre is located near Södertälje, where the Swedish truck manufacturer's headquarters and factory are located. Four new Krone trailers have a permanent place in the test fleet for visitors and customers from all over the world.

title: 25 years Krone Cool-Liner
summary: The year 2021 is a very special year for Krone: because the refrigerated semi-trailer celebrates its 25th birthday this year. This is, of course, reason enough to look back into the history of the Krone Cool Liner and follow the development of the product from 1996 to the present day. In 25 years, the Krone Cool Liner has been constantly revised and further developed and has thus become what it is today: a premium refrigerated semi-trailer from Krone.

title: CELSINEO – Successful test marathon for modular trailer c
summary: KRONE Cool Liners were equipped with CELSINEO refrigeration units for single-temp applications and used intensively by 20 freight forwarders in temperature-controlled transport operations. The tests have been running in various stages since 2017 over a period of three years. This not only enabled the flexibility, availability and efficiency of the vehicles to be demonstrated, but also allowed comparisons to be made with conventional refrigeration units from other manufacturers.

title: Maximilian Birle new in the Krone team
summary: On 1 April, Maximilian Birle took over the management of the "Sales & Service Telematics and Digital Services" department at Fahrzeugwerk Krone. The 36-year-old has already been able to successfully develop and sell numerous digitisation projects at a leading global capital goods group over the past ten years. "I am very much looking forward to the new challenge at the Krone Commercial Vehicle Group. Especially in the transport industry, there are diverse, exciting tasks around telematics and digitisation; the entire industry has an extremely high potential for digitisation. Krone has already set some remarkable milestones in this segment and is known as a particularly innovative company with great, dedicated teams in both the agricultural technology and commercial vehicle sectors."

title: Jetzt investieren und staatliche Fördermittel nutzen
summary: Das Förderprogramm zur Erneuerung der Nutzfahrzeugflotten (ENF) wurde kürzlich angepasst: Die Förderung der Anschaffung sogenannter intelligenter Trailer-Technologie wird von der Flottenerneuerung (Verschrottung und Neuerwerb eines schweren Nutzfahrzeuges) entkoppelt. Ab sofort können Sie also Förderanträge stellen, die allein auf die Förderung der Anschaffung von intelligenten Technologien gerichtet sind, die zur Reduzierung der CO2-Emissionen beitragen und somit den Energieverbrauch des Gesamtzuges mindern. Die Förderhöchstsumme von bis zu 5.000 Euro oder maximal 60 Prozent der Anschaffungskosten pro Trailer Feature wird beim Kauf solcher Trailer gefördert.

title: Krone new cooperation partner of Alltrucks
summary: Alltrucks Truck & Trailer Service and Krone - one of the world's leading trailer manufacturers - are entering into a future-oriented cooperation. The more than 700 Alltrucks partner workshops throughout Europe will thus benefit from the added OE expertise. In addition, fleets benefit from a fully comprehensive and brand-independent service scope for trucks and trailers within the Alltrucks workshop network.

title: 15 Dry Liner for PPTL
summary: Mesut Kaya, authorised signatory of Pro Performance Transport & Logistik GmbH (PPTL) and Isa Alakir, IT Management at PPTL, used the collection of 15 new Dry Liners to visit the Krone site in Herzlake, where the Dry Liners were manufactured. Krone Regional Sales Manager Philipp Werth and Björn Budde, Krone Sales Manager Germany, welcomed the guests from Dieburg in southern Hesse and thanked them for the renewed order. Visibly impressed by the ultra-modern, partly robot-supported production, the guests then drove to the Krone site in Werlte, where Mesut Kaya and Isa Alakir were also able to take a look at the high-tech coating centre.

title: Krone: new rear underrun guard as of March
summary: Starting in March, Krone will gradually equip its vehicles with the newly designed rear underrun guard, which significantly increases passive safety in traffic.

title: Arcese innovates by investing in sustainable logistics
summary: The development of intermodal transportation, and the focus on sustainability are two of the Arcese Group’s priorities. Over the years, the Arcese Group has continued to invest in the creation of an integrated and flexible European network, as well as in the standardisation of its fleet of semi-trailers suitable for intermodal transport.

title: Krone telematics unit now also with solar power
summary: Krone has developed a new version of the Krone Smart Collect telematics unit for its popular swap systems. The highlight: thanks to the integrated solar panel, the telematic unit runs autonomously and maintenance-free after installation.

title: More than 10,000 users in the spare parts shop
summary: Since February 2021, the number of users of the Krone Spare Parts Shop has reached five figures: Krone registered the 10,000th user of the online shop at the beginning of the winter month. In the event of a claim, more and more customers and service partners from numerous countries, from Chile to Russia, rely on the fast and reliable availability of Krone spare parts, which are dispatched individually either by overnight shipment or within a defined time window, if required. The state-of-the-art distribution centre in Herzlake that opened exactly three years ago, in February 2018, also serves important Krone locations in Budapest, Lyon, Scandinavia and the Baltic States.

title: De-minimis Förderprogramm für 2021 verlängert
summary:
Im Rahmen des Förderprogramms „De-minimis“ werden auch im Jahr 2021 Unternehmen des Güterkraftverkehrs gefördert, die bestimmte Maßnahmen zur Erhöhung der Sicherheit oder zur Verbesserung des Umweltschutzes durchführen. 
So können Unternehmen u.a. zur Anschaffung von Kofferaufbauten, Planen mit Diebstahlschutzeinrichtungen, Huckepack-Ausstattung, Ladungssicherungs-Features und/oder Telematik-Systemen einen Zuschuss erhalten.

title: There is always something to transport
summary: New year, new transport equipment - according to this motto, Andreas Back, Head of Quality Management/Environment at Hornbach Baumarkt AG, took delivery of the eleventh Krone Profi Liner and the first of eleven new Krone construction material trailers. On the occasion of the handover, Krone Regional Sales Manager Markus Gemmel thanked Hornbach for the trust it has placed in Krone since the 1990s. In the beginning, it was mainly swap body trailers that were used, but today Hornbach relies on its own so-called recyclables liner logistics, which currently comprises eleven semi-trailers. One semi-trailer is used as a promotional vehicle with a superstructure of an oversized nail.

title: New service partner
summary:
Every haulier knows the situation: a driver reports a breakdown, the vehicle is stuck. Now fast, competent help is needed. Krone Mobility offers this service through its new premium partner 'EBTS Always in Motion'. In the event of a breakdown, the driver contacts the EBTS emergency call centre, gives his or her name, the vehicle registration number, the chassis number, the company name of the vehicle owner and the location, and a team is on its way. Of course, EBTS is available free of charge around the clock, seven days a week. Another plus point: EBTS services are available in 18 languages; so drivers can be sure that there will be no communication problems in the event of an emergency call. 
The new pan-European Krone Mobility service numbers are: 
00800 225 55 76 76 or +49 (0) 5951 209 902.

title: New from Krone: Krone Trusted
summary: Every freight forwarder is familiar with the following situation: When a part needs to be replaced on a trailer that is already a little older, they often consider whether it is still worthwhile to install an expensive original spare part. Krone now offers an interesting alternative with the new spare parts brand Krone Trusted.

title: Ready to take on new challenges
summary:
After a relatively good start to the 2019/2020 financial year (1 August 2019 to 31 July 2020), all business activities have been impacted by Covid-19 since the beginning of 2020. With the pandemic taking centre stage, other topical issues like the Brexit negotiations and various protectionist import tariff measures have taken a backseat although these did have significant impacts on the international operations of the Krone Group. While the agricultural machinery division continued to grow, Commercial Vehicles lost business. In the last financial year the Krone Group generated a turnover of 1.9 billion euros (previous year around 2.2 billion euros). About 32.9% of the domestic sales were accounted for by the Agriculture and 66.8% by the Commercial Vehicle business. With about 29.3% of all sales being generated in the domestic market (previously 30.9%), 70.7% of the Krone sales revenues were generated in markets outside Germany (previously 69.1%).
(*The difference of 0.3% is accounted for by merchandise sales.)

title: Walter Krone deceased
summary: Walter Krone passed away on 3 January 2021 after a long serious illness at the age of 79.
